title: Computer Networks
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to computer networks. Students will learn fundamental concepts including network, implementation, testing. The course covers data, algorithm with emphasis on practical programming. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in algorithm and data.
scope: Topics covered include: trees, queues, linked lists, and hash tables. Students should have basic knowledge of optimization. Prerequisites: None or introductory computer science course.

title: Entrepreneurship
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to entrepreneurship. Students will learn fundamental concepts including operations, analysis, management. The course covers planning, finance with emphasis on practical finance. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in planning and management.
scope: Topics covered include: business models, financial statements, supply chain, and team dynamics. Students should have basic knowledge of marketing. Prerequisites: None or introductory business course.

title: Nursing Fundamentals
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to nursing fundamentals. Students will learn fundamental concepts including clinical, treatment, care. The course covers wellness, prevention with emphasis on practical health. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in disease and diagnosis.
scope: Topics covered include: vital signs, patient assessment, medications, and clinical procedures. Students should have basic knowledge of care. Prerequisites: None or introductory healthcare course.

title: Learning Theories
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to learning theories. Students will learn fundamental concepts including curriculum, education, teaching. The course covers development, cognition with emphasis on practical motivation. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in cognition and development.
scope: Topics covered include: learning styles, differentiated instruction, cognitive development, and lesson planning. Students should have basic knowledge of pedagogy. Prerequisites: None or introductory education course.

title: Public Health Management
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to public health management. Students will learn fundamental concepts including health, care, diagnosis. The course covers medical, practice with emphasis on practical practice. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in medical and diagnosis.
scope: Topics covered include: infection control, clinical procedures, cardiovascular system, and health promotion. Students should have basic knowledge of prevention. Prerequisites: None or introductory healthcare course.

description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to organizational behavior. Students will learn fundamental concepts including customer, performance, profit. The course covers strategy, marketing with emphasis on practical planning. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in decision and leadership.
scope: Topics covered include: financial statements, competitive analysis, risk management, and market research. Students should have basic knowledge of profit. Prerequisites: None or introductory business course.

title: Machine Learning Basics
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to machine learning basics. Students will learn fundamental concepts including algorithm, optimization, code. The course covers data, system with emphasis on practical security. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in architecture and testing.
scope: Topics covered include: hash tables, queues, complexity analysis, and trees. Students should have basic knowledge of optimization. Prerequisites: None or introductory computer science course.
